No.1 外刊阅读

1. 武汉肺炎

The Chinese coronavirus

Fortunately, the world is better prepared than ever to stop it

As the Economist went to press,over 600 cases had been confirmed in six countries,of which 17 were fatal.The new virus is a close relative of sars (severe acute respiratory syndrome),which emerged in China in 2002 and terrorised the world for over half a year before burning out.Sars afflicted more than 8000 people and killed about 800,leaving in its wake $30bn-100bn of damage from disrupted trade and travel.

That toll would have been lower if the Chinese authorities had not hushed up the outbreak for months.But things are very different this time.The Chinese have been forthcoming and swift to act.Doctors in Wuhan,ths metropoils where it began,have come in for criticism,but the signs are that they promptly sounded an alarm about an unusual cluster of cases of pneumonia-thereby following a standard protocol for spotting new viruses

The WHO has long worried about the possible emergence of a “disease x” that could become a serious international pandemic and which has no known counter-measures.Some experts say the virus found in China could be a threat of this kind.And there will be many others.Further illnesses will follow the same well-trodden path,by mutaing from bugs that live in animals into ones that can infect people.Better vigilance in places where humans and animals mingle,as they do in markets across Asia,would help catch viral newcomers early.A tougher task is dissuading people from eating wild animals and convincing them to handle livestock with care,using masks and gloves when butchering meat and fish,for example,Such measures might have prevented the new coronavirus from ever making headlines

2.精读与思考

第一段翻译(其中的加粗单词也会在翻译中加粗，以后不会再提示)

截止经济学家/人交付打印的时候，有超过600个案例已经被证实出现在6个城市中，他们(案例)之间有17个是处于重症范畴（致命的。这次的新型病毒是SARS(严重急性呼吸综合征)的近亲，(SARS)是在2002年出现（浮现）在中国并在它消亡(熄灭)之前恐吓世界长达半年之久。sars折磨了多达8000的人¹并且致死了约800人，贸易和旅游的中断造成了30-100百万美元的损失(在那之后）

如果当时中国政府²没有隐瞒疫情(爆发的疫情)数月，(死亡)人数本该可以更少的。但是这次情况大不相同。中国积极并快速地行动(这里的forthcoming是向前的意思，我不知道咋翻译…)，处于疫情开始的大都市——武汉中的医生们受到了批评³，但是迹象表明：他们(医生)迅速地 拉响了有关一堆(群)不同寻常的肺炎病例的警告——他们是遵循了“发现新病毒”后应该执行的标准协议

1: 其实这里我不太懂为啥，按照原文的意思是sars有超过8000的感染者，但是原文使用了afflict即折磨，使痛苦，我觉得这里使用infect(感染)可能更合适
2: 正式的写作中，authority比goverment更能体现政府权威的意思，毕竟authority里面有权力/威的意思
3: (雾..为啥医生受到批评？？李文亮医生吗？…) criticise wenliang Li ?注意:原文里面是criticism,是名词，criticise是动词，批评

3.重点词汇/短语

  • went/go to press 付印，泛指杂志即将交付印刷

    press做名词指报刊杂志,也可以认为是记者，例如the press

  • fatal形容词，我多见于git报错……，指的是出了致命性/毁灭性的错误(雾…)

    you push a fatal error to master, shit!近义词mortal

    它的名词形式比较特殊：fatality(事故，战争造成的死亡，近义词mortality –死亡数量

    突然联想到xx男孩的inmortal –永恒的，不朽的
